attributes.action: Demand that the UK government publishes the Russia Report.
attributes.additional_details:
The Russia Report was commissioned in November 2017 and documents the results of the inquiry by the Intelligence Security Committee into alleged Russian interference in the 2017 General Election and 2016 referendum. 

It is complete and was passed to the Prime Minister in October 2019 but, has yet, not been released. The government must publish it immediately so that the UK electorate can know its contents, and the implications it has for British democracy now and in the future.
attributes.background: A Parliamentary report, known as the Russia Report - which examines alleged Russian interference in UK democracy, has yet to be published. It must be released to the public immediately.
